FuncDef:
The loop-detect trigger min-port-uptime command configures the system to start proactive loop detection on an interface after a specified period elapses since the interface status changes from Down to Up.
The undo loop-detect trigger min-port-uptime command restores the default configuration.
By default, the system starts proactive loop detection 10 seconds after a Down interface goes Up.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the minimum interval between the time when the interface goes Down and the time when the interface goes Up.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 100, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the minimum interval at which an interface changes from Down to Up does not meet the requirement, you can run this command to set the desired interval.
Configuration Impact
The minimum interval at which an interface changes from Down to Up is changed.
